dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S2846 IS: HIV Medication Access Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Rosen (for herself, Mr. Kaine, Mr. Van Hollen, Ms. Cortez Masto, Mr. Schiff, Ms. Duckworth, Mr. Booker, Mrs. Murray, Mr. Heinrich, and Mr. Sanders) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations

form.official-title: To amend the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 to modify treatment activities for assistance to combat HIV/AIDS.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the HIV Medication Access Act.

section.header: Modification of prevention activities for assistance to combat HIV/AIDS
section.text: Section 104A(d) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 (22 U.S.C. 2151b–2(d)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by inserting , which shall be considered to be core life-saving humanitarian assistance, before including;
in subparagraph (J), by striking the period at the end and inserting a semicolon;
in subparagraph (K)(viii), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:
assistance to provide HIV pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) medications.
subparagraph (D), by adding and at the end; and
in subparagraph (E), by striking the semicolon at the end and inserting a period; and
by inserting , including at-risk populations in accordance with a scientific-based analysis designated by the World Health Organization, after specific populations;

by striking efforts to reduce the risk of HIV/AIDS infection including and inserting efforts to reduce the risk of HIV/AIDS infection, which shall be considered to be core life-saving humanitarian assistance, including pre- and; and
by inserting , which shall be considered to be core life-saving humanitarian assistance before the period at the end.
